I can’t do that to you, y’ know? | Yer too nice, you don’t deserve that.” - “I’m offering you a job .” - “He’ll kill me.” - “We have protection.” - “…” - “…” - Chasmus takes off her scarf and wraps it around Honey’s wounds. - “You’re okay,” says Chasmus. “I’ll help you.” - “Why?” - “Think of it as repayment,” says Chasmus. - tl;dr - Chasmus feels bad for her and is like, “you were kinda good at what u do I see ya workin so I think you shoudl get a job, also you shouldn’t let him do that to you” and honey says “but I’m 90% metal” and Chasmus says “stfu” - So honey is like, eternally grateful ;; the general restaurant is alright, pretty below average but tightly knit. She’s been working there for like, four years?
docs.title: Misc

docs.text: Signature Ability : Aloof Honeycakes takes no hit reactions from attacks that deal less than 10% of her MAX HP. while in SHIFT, this will increase to 20%. Additionally, Honeycakes can just ignore gravity and decide to either fall faster or slower (depends on whether W/S or up arrow/down arrow is pressed while she is falling. ) Extended Ability: Heavyweight Landing on enemies from above deals bonus damage + armor break. Gain additional +50% damage if done while in SHIFT. Enemies afflicted will gain +STUN for 3 seconds. While an enemy is stunned, gain +3% HP per second of the stun. (MAX 75%). This attack stacks for each stunned enemy. Role : Heavyweight Tank You know the type. Heavy-hitting but hideously slow. That’s Honeycakes. Not much else to say! Base : BLUNT FORCE TRAUMA Honeycakes wields her nasty, nasty hammer to swing at enemies. Nothing’s too heavy for Honeycakes, but it still remains at an astounding 1 ton (joke). She swings quickly (for her standards) twice, then lands a third heavy hit which can launch the opponent. While in SHIFT, deal an additional fourth hit. She doesn’t react to ANY hits while doing her third hit. Shift : Locked in. Reflect 50% of all physical damage taken (does not count for projectile or magic attacks) gain +2 stacks of ARMOR (armor reduction +20%), and gain +1 for each 5 seconds spent in SHIFT (max: 5). When Honeycakes leaves SHIFT, all armor stacks are converted into +5% HP. HOWEVER, for each heat stack applied, remove 3% of that buff. Honeycake’s fourth attack will release a shockwave which knocks enemies back and inflicts stun for .5 seconds. If there are more than 4 enemies hit by the shockwave, STUN duration increases by +2 seconds. Does not work on bosses. “Patch notes” Hard-Headed • Upon activation, Honey suffers 25% dmg of all hits taken for the next 3 seconds or so, then launches it all back into one beam attack. However, this stuns her for a period of time and she takes 25% damage of max HP on recoil (set) • Passive: • +25% crit rate or knockback damage.
docs.title: Gameplay

docs.text: This note is UNFINISHED. Lived in Sosolensk daughter of Marian Personality Nea, overall, is an egotistical brat. Yes, she’s smart enough to back that up, but she thinks awfully highly of herself. She’s horribly selfish, she only works for herself, and herself only. No one needs to know more about her. With that, she’s stoic and cold and would barely respond to you. She’s got a slender and tall build, with a hefty ponytail which could blanket a small child. Nea’s a feisty little thing. She’s aggressive and passionate, but tries not to let it slip out to preserve her image. She can be extremely rude, but sometimes she isn’t aware of it, so you’ll just have to tell her directly. She tries not to show any emotion, but she isn’t great at it. She comes across as more of a “Tsundere” than a cold and serious person once you get to know her. She’s pretty intimidating and likes to stay organized and on-top of things. She’s a perfectionist to a fault. _Psychotically smart, Nea’s got some pretty fucked up ideas and thoughts in her head. Backstory Nea’s origins are unknown to her. She woke up in a temple and grew up in a temple. One of the first students of General Worldbuilding , she grew as an exceptional musician and an expert at manipulating magic to her will. Age 18 was the day to take over her father. She doesn’t really like her father. Cold and stoic and harsh, that’s all. No loving relationship whatsoever, barely even a father. And God knows what sort of mother she might’ve had should she had lived. At age 18, a woman in violet and black robes waltzes into the lobby. Recognized as Pyrrhon, world leader. War leader. The only person in power and the only person to remain in power. Nea could really care less. Until she walks into her room and sees her father’s corpse, mangled and burnt. And who else to stand above it but that woman? “My daughter,” she says to Nea. “I found you.” ”I am not your daughter.” Her father coughs up blood. Marian , renowned warrior, accomplished magician. Cowering at her feet like an animal. Marian reaches into the depths of his chest, and out comes a beating heart. Not a heart, a CORE. A machine of dreams and delusions. Nea looks up at Pyrrhon. Pyrrhon looks down at her daughter. Nea’s a skilled swordsman. Launching forward in a flurry of attacks, but not enough! Pyrrhon’s quick on her feet, Pyrrhon’s smart. Why else is she a world leader? Her father lays motionless. Pyrrhon only grins. All Nea remembers from that day is running out of the temple, now in flames. Centuries of history and dreams of the unknown, all dancing in the wind with the flames. She looks down at her fingers, burning with flames. She looks up at the temple again, and feels nothing. Five years later, no one knows it was her. Not that many people knew that temples still existed, anyway. Much less that one burned down in the middle of nowhere. She attends schools and colleges, since what else could you do? But slave away her magic for a machine which rejected the very idea of her? Nea only bites her teeth and steels herself. No point in fighting a losing battle. That is, until a little clone named Gamma stole something particularly important to her. Relationship with... Marian She despises him. She believes him to be the root cause of every single one of her issues. And she isn’t very wrong about that. When Nea was four years old, Marian met her for the first time. He had such an immense breakdown, he almost killed Nea at the altar and sacrificed her. He was stopped by the temple guards. When Nea was six years old, Marian began to teach her how to sword fight. it entailed lots and lots of physical violence between them both. At sixteen, Baluch (). Marian walked in right as Baluch did it and thrwe Baluch Out by the scruff of his neck. He handed Nea some clothes without a word and instructed her to get changed. Baluch ended up with such horrific wounds he was permanently paralyzed from the legs down. Marian was not kicked out, but he was severely demoted. i mean, they really hated each other. Marian saw her as an embodiment of Pyrrhon that he couldn’t escape. Nea saw him as an insufferable wife beater. They have had three civil conversations. One when she met Khan, one when Baluch assaulted her, and one at his suicide. She doesn’t understand him and frankly she isn’t very interested to do so. Gamma Gamma is an anomaly to her. Simultaneously the most human non-human she’s ever met. A weird amalgamation of morals mixed with bloodshed. Initially she was drawn to Gamma because of her odd morality, like an object to study. Also, because she didn’t have much of a choice at the time. But Gamma just intrigues her. And engineers are known for their undying curiosity Constantine She has nothing to say about him. Honeycakes A strained older-sister type relationship. Shenx Shenx temporarily grew up in the same religious sect as she did, so they bond over that. Shenx is a bit bad with religious customs, but Nea helps him out. She’s also a great information broker for him, so he enjoys having her. She’s also a backup for Gamma Shou Shou respects Nea because Nea’s the only one to both leave her alone and put up with her bullshit. She doesnt like Nea, but she tolerates her. Which is a lot better than most Khan She hates him more Than anything. As the next embodiment of her father, he’s the one to stake the blame in his place. Rhaika-Lei She thinks he’s a stuck up pompous bastard who deserves nothing that he’s “achieved”. MISC The Malleable Object. All that’s left of her father’s CORE is his hopes in dreams: in liquid form! It’s pink and glittery and shines dimly at normal levels. It’s malleable, which means she can form it into any object: but the more deadly the object, the more energy it takes for her to form it. She typically uses it as a shield. It is mainly used as a transportation device. She tends to sprint for short distances, but gets tired and ends up running the rest of the way. Imagine it like a hoverboard. The malleable object can break, but it will repair over time. When it does, however, it takes a very long time to heal, and Nea is basically helpless. She yells to Gamma or Honeycakes for help, since she can’t do much. The Malleable object can only form into things that Nea knows the ins and outs of from memory. Basically construction from memory. it can go into musical instruments, but she must provide the reed. Nea likes grapes and grape-flavored items. She likes graphing calculators a lot, she really wants one but has never bought one. Nea likes sparkling drinks of any time, especially spiked ones, but she’ll only drink it if it contains sugar of some kind She prefers suits over dresses. She really likes chocolate-flavored items, especially cakes. Despite her mainly playing her viola, she plays other instruments. Her other favorites include the oboe, double bass, and piano. She is practicing alto saxophone right now. Nea likes hardstyle techno, and phantom of the opera She and Balach were in a situationship a while back, so they’re particularly bitter against each other. He overstepped her boundaries, but ONCE. Marian walked in and beat the living shit out of Balach. He took Nea out of the temple and sent her to school. It was the only time she saw him cry, even at his death. her birthday is November 13th. The rapture was Nov 10. She’s not the biggest fan. Childhood Nea as a child,, She’s like, Really self-centered and quite manipulative, she used her looks and good reputation to gain attention from people around her to give her stuff. She bought a lot of stupid items. She was particularly good at love bombing and gaslighting She was okay at school, for a time. She had a small phase where she rebelled (they had the money to just stop..) and dropped out of school for a while to do random shit, like sports. But her dad forced her back in. Even as a kid, she was really loud. She didn’t cry but she wailed, and she wailed a lot. She was a stubborn little brat who always wanted her way. Quite literally no empathy for other people, she was one of THOSE popular kids. Nea was taken out of her last two years of middle school to do intensive temple training, which actually brought her back into shape and she became a little less spoiled. She became good at fighting and was now really educated in religion and everything because she literally worked her ASS off (out of complete spite, there was another girl she didn’t like in her program). Her dad congratulated her, which gave her the confidence to start trying in school. In high school, she was like twilight sparkle but more sociable. She was “popular”, but mostly because the popular kids there liked her because she’d let them cheat off her homework. She went to the same school Chasmus went to, fun fact. Anyway, she ended up getting a boyfriend. She thought that she could easily take advantage of his new money for her own advantage, but no! Nea actually got uh, into a very bad and toxic relationship! I mean, sure, she had “relationships” but none of those guys could really “handle her” (poor and she was really energetic and got too excited a lot). He kinda, like, used her for her body and turned all of her previous manipulation tactics against her, so she was in a terrible state until she was taken out AGAIN for more religious training, which she was pretty happy to do. So for three years, she didn’t step foot outside of her temple. She was in a pretty nasty mental state, and it’s not like her dad really helped her with that. Marian doesn’t know how to deal with kids so he’s kinda emotionally neglectful and lashes out at them a lot. He’s actually a little abusive, so Nea had a bad relationship with him. He also hated her because of what happened with Pyrrhon, but he was getting better slowly and was now (badly) trying to spark a relationship with her. However she rejected 99% of attempts (except one, which was near the end). So she mastered the art of Refined Magic, good job, Nea! By this time, she’d graduated high school solely off of religious exemption and now worked at her temple for one more year, until Pyrrhon invaded it, and then she burned the temple down,, Mostly because she had almost never suffered the consequences of her own actions before. Anything broken could always be replaced with her money, but her father is gone, and years of history is now ash, and Pyrrhon’s after her, and she’s completely useless now. She never talked about her religious background, but bought herself a fake identity after working a year or so in the underworld. She went to school for engineering and minored in music while working her side job in the underworld, But like, she got fired.. and like, she met Gamma.. and like, got kicked out of school because she’s rumored to be dead.. After Marian’s death she became really quiet and completely reconstructed herself as a being. She’s also really NARCISITIC STILL HONESTLY FUCKING LEARN!!! But she leans on the independent, “I’m better than you and you will taint me by your presence!” Playstyle Role: Classic all rounder, self-sustainer While she has a pretty heavy lean into magic attacks, she’s quite slow compared to others. She’s a mid-ranged attacker who can dish out all kinds of attacks and heal herself. She’s more of a jack of all trades (with a heavy lean into her special attacks). Signature Ability : RHYTHMIC DISSONANCE Each combo hit above 5 will add an increased +1% damage to the next hit. this stacks on top of other bonuses ie 6 hit: 101% dmg 7 hits: 102% dmg (+2% of it's normal damage) 8 hits: 103% dmg ... etc. This value resets once the combo ends Extended Ability: Counterpoint! If Nea is hit mid-swing by a PHYSICAL attack, then trigger a parry slash. Also, gain the ability to cancel an enemy attack once every 5 seconds. Base : Swords Dance Exactly what it sounds like! Nea does two quick slashes then a down swing. Shift : Grace Notes All melee attacks gain +1 phantom hit at 50% damage (visually distinct, hits slightly after the main strike) These phantom hits count toward combo count and RHYTHMIC DISSONANCE bonus. All phantom hits deal magic damage. Parrying during Grace Notes automatically resets the cooldown of your next combo finisher, letting you loop offense faster. HOWEVER Nea will eventually get bored and tired of this, so SHIFT can only last for about 12 seconds before she goes back. 20 second cooldown between each. ULTIMATE : ()) aaaa ”patch notes”: Old ultimate: Passive regen for all teammates for the duration of her ult. ULT - Martyr (if neutral is pressed). Heals 25-75% of Nea’s missing HP to her teammates, but not her. She also provides shields for each new teammate which tags in, but weaker that Constantine. ULT - Blood Drive (if special is pressed) Every single attack deals like +3 hits of splash damage for a few seconds. Works particularly well with her CHAINING ability. ULT- Rhaika-Lei reveals his third eye, which shoots two dragons out of his soul to attack all of the enemies within his line of sight in a straight line. It will freeze them and temporarily interrupt almost all attacks, except for those immune to interruptions. Applies the ‘inked’ debuff to the enemies, which essentially grants more damage dealt to them, the more that they are hit with the ink. Destroying the enemy will replenish all of the ink, and can be thrown again to the next enemy. Ability : RHYTHMIC DISSONANCE Each combo hit above 5 will add an increased +1% damage to the next hit. this stacks on top of other bonuses ie 6 hit: 101% dmg 7 hits: 102% dmg (+2% of it's normal damage) 8 hits: 103% dmg ... etc. This value resets once the combo ends Base : Swords Dance Exactly what it sounds like! Nea does two quick slashes then a down swing. Shift : VOID AFINITY By sacrificing 10% of Nea's Max Health She will summon a small 'void'. Each 'void' will add one additional combo hit to each new combo. All damage caused by the 'voids' are considered as magic damage. Basically A normal combo is 4 hits for Nea +1 void = 5 hits +2 voids = 6 hits +3 voids = 7 hits +4 voids = 9 hits It caps out at 4 voids (-40% max health) Additionally, when removing a void, restore 5% max health AND recover 5% of all damage caused . Howver, doing this will cause all voids to cease, and will leave Nea vulnurable for a period of time ULTIMATE:

docs.title: Pyrrhon

docs.text: A building thats so incredibly large. The colosseum, it’s called. Head of entertainment and manufacturing. Since it has a mass amount of factories, to cut down on transportation costs, most of the shops compressed into the nearby area. A lot of people also steal their stuff and sell it in the underground for a cheaper price, but sometimes they’ll tamper with it. This is where the National Guardian Association holds their annual competition and where the Slaughterhouse’s HQ resides. Very very high end area, looks quite clean but most of everything is just shoved underground/Into the oceans/into other domes. Mostly rich people live here, everything is really overpriced. It looks like the Singapore airport and the entire LA combined. Outskirts are mostly casinos, cheap bars, sex hotels, and low-end shops. It also leads to the most accessible Underground area. A lot of druggies and homeless people who’ve gone into debt live around this area, but not much is really done about it. If you go shopping, this is the place to go. But it’s very dirty and dusty. Middome is where the residential area is and recreation. This includes shops, parks, amusement parks, hotels, restaurants, etc. It’s the largest Middome anywhere. Innerdome is the ENTIRE colosseum. I kid you not. It’s so large it’s so fucking big dude it has HOTELS inside of it, it has RESTAURANTS it has SHOPS it has CASINOS dude like 50% of the Innerdome is for spectators. Smallest and most accessible innerdome available. While it has the size of a normal dome, not many people consider it a dome because of how little is done there. The majority of people on Earth have visited Dome 3 Once due to how easily accessible everythi_n_g is (prices and taxes not included).
docs.title: Colosseum

docs.text: *”…She’d never been to Hà Binh, much less Sampaguita or Phisit. Nor did she particularly want to, but such is life. It didn’t help that the closest landmass next to her just so happened to be Phisit. Gamma sighs again, and adjusts Nea who had begun to fall off again. How’d they even make it to Phisit? Hà Binh was at least a three-day trip from where they were originally, or at least where she thought they were. But, the undeniable smell of rotting fish and burning spices lingered in the air. Phisit was in front of her whether she liked it or not… Gamma checks her watch. 7AM. How long had she been walking? oh well. She takes a big, deep breath, and shuffles meekly into Phisit. Quite honestly, it was just as smelly as she’d imagined it would be. It was hot, even at 7… 8… 9 AM. Humid and sweaty, but also quite charming, as she’d come to realize. There was a certain thing with vendors completely ignoring the entity on your back while they yelled in foreign languages. There was also no border security awake at the time which she found quite nice. But honestly, the smell of spices, fish, and manure were better than rusting metal, so she’d much preferred it. Even Nea began to stir, upon passing the walls of cured meat and drying insects.”* The home to Constantine and Honeycakes . Most similar to present day Baguio and Bontoc. Phisit Sampaguita the street market Because quite honestly, that’s all it’s known for. It's hot and humid and smells mostly of cured meat. It's very crowded and everyone is prone to robbing and mugging. Despite that, the community is generally happy, and the buildings are colorful (despite the mold). What the place lacks in cleanliness it makes up for in soul. Ngima Up in the mountains.. The hometown to Constantine . A smelly mountain which was built up upon mounds of trash and scrap metal. It was home to a long lost tribe, who left a cavern of intricate tunnels and strange statues along with it. They have mostly been covered and filled due to landslides, but particularly daring historians enjoy digging through it. Ngima is too far up for any locals to get to/from Sampaguita, which just so happens to be right next to it, so they remain in itself. Ngima is quite the poor country. Most of its residents live in small houses of scrap metal, which are stacked up on top of each other. Electricity is mostly shared between houses and under a strict curfew. While there are “laws”, the law enforcement isn’t particularly fond of going up and down the hill to Ngima. It’s an extremely religious community known for its very *very* low living standards and lack of almost everything. Ngima’s denizens usually receive food from either monthly trips to Sampaguita, or from airplanes. all buildings are on a large, steep hill, almost basically 50-60 degrees. The vendors and houses who live on it support themselves upright using various pieces of metal, scrap, and children’s textbooks. When it rains, the place is basically off limits because it turns into a glorified water slide. If you were to look up at the sky in Ngima, you’d see the desolate, grey sky, the wires, and then a cicada would probably fly into your mouth, so don’t do that. It’s a very gloomy place. Constantine lived near the top of Ngima so he wasn’t very socialized. When Honeycakes found out that Constantine lived in Ngima, she considered leaving Gamma and Nea “*The sky’s bout as blue as an old, rotting car. It’s got some tints of you imagine hard enough, but the exterior’s too much brown and grey to see much of anything. Little pebbles of sticky, green slush trickle down from the sky, pittering and pattering on the rusty roofing’s of Sampaguita’s houses.he air is thick with the stench of iron and sour lemons. The fog blankets down on Ngima like a thick coating of glue. Despite it, there’s still the familiar shouts of marketkeep within their enclosed bubbles. The bubbles were nothing special. Some clear, semi-permeable membrane they all set up. Allows in large life forms, but no bugs and rain. The steam from the meat hovers at the top, obscuring the view of the vendors. Ngima’s set up on this 70 degree plane, so he’s surprised that anyone still lives here. He’s more so surprised that he’s walking up this goddamn hill with the rain against him. But so were the schoolchildren. So were the salarymen. He was nothing special. The bubbles were held upright by leaking cardboard boxes and old children’s textbooks, obscuring the buildings they sat in front of.”* Gouha The not-so-smelly area. well, of course! It was created for corporations after all.. Notable locations: Iron Lantern Street Grill * Honeycakes ’ work area. Home of Regina n Sam . Statue of Nebai “ From the two-armed statue of Nebai, she sees the sun. It was designed as one of their landmarks, where the sun would go up and down all 12 arms of Nebai. However you had to stay at a specific spot, which just so happened to be mostly covered up by buildings, so the whole thing was quite useless. At least she could make out the sun at this point.” A statue created in the honor of Nebai, a god in (insert religion here). one of the most notable landmarks in Phisit, despite how incompetently it was created. It is truly a work of art, though, with intricate carvings all along the body and hair of the goddess, made by various craftsman. Her clothes were made of shards from various historical artifacts and pottery.
docs.title: Hà Binh

docs.text: abbreviated to “NML” usually. The remaining 75% of Earth from the Rapture, which is more like 30% now. This is mostly because from science either reversing the effects, or people just building over it no matter what. It’s infested with deep and lush forests, but it’s simply too dangerous for anyone to really survive out for long. Also, thirty percent of Earth is HUGE. This is why being exiled is so powerful. Because outside of the forests is simply nothing . No one knows what’s beyond No Man’s Land outside of a few abandoned experiments who roam around devouring the exiled. Prodigal is one. Being exiled is quite literally worse than the death penalty. Aerial shots show that no man’s land has “layers”. From closest to current society, it goes: Forests, swamps, and finally to a black stain near the top of the Earth, and a hideously large mountain. That is where God fell. There are rumors of people who live in No Man’s Land. There are a lot of fairy tales about this! People like Vincent the Great and the series’ “Intergalactic Wings” and “Managohr” both take place or draw heavy inspiration from NML. Tbh NML is more of a joke than a real thing, due to how rare Exilation is. “Haha! You’re gonna be sent to No Man’s Land! Don’t say that!” “No Man’s Land’s better than this!!” Fun fact: Marian is the only person to travel NML and live . Versailles, the old temple, was there. Also, Pyrrhon and other scientists are just too scared to go to NML. They dont know what happened since nature mutated uncontrollably since that time. A few people live in NML actually, but they’re more of ‘gangs’ than real ‘towns’. They also all die. It has no laws so it appeals to a few people who actualy survive. They’re like Amish people but extremely violent
docs.title: No Man's Land

docs.text: a brief introduction on how to read the location system in CORE. Now, a typical business card might look something like this: “ Great Food! Nice Snacks! Iron Lantern Street Grlil Reel , autentic meat at 50% price!! Come check on out us. Sampaguita, Phisit; HBNH - DN3807. ” … with better English, most of the time. The code at the bottom describes the exact location. From largest to smallest, it goes from Hà-Binh , a country Phisit, a county Sampaguita, a city DN(code), direct address within that city. DN stands for District Number. The code works like this: First three letters are for the exact street. in this case, street 38. The other two are for where the building is exactly located. 07 means that it is the seventh building from the right side.
docs.title: Reading

docs.text: Home to Comakin , 07 ANGEL , Moniqua , and Kyuunai . Story Notes Sosolensk isn’t really known as being the fanciest place around, but it is most certainly known for those who live in it. A former battlefield for Pyrrhon now turned into the coldest country. Similarly to current day Russia, most Sosolensk denizens are portrayed as cold, strong, and incredibly intimidating. It’s up in the snowy mountains, up in the center. It’s much flatter and more prosperous than Hà-Binh , known for its rich architecture and strict culture. Living conditions aren’t as awful as Ngima but, they’re not too great either (depending on where you go). Sosolensk is sort of like Hawaii, the hot stop vacation for white girls pretending to be adventurous. Larger areas like Pyatinsty and Shaskala are much more inhabitable, but there are cities and people who live deep in the mountains hunting frozen meat. Pyatintsy The ice palace The place of rumors! Somewhere deep in the less populated areas of Sosolensk, mostly of for tribal people and extreme explorers. A gorgeous place, if you do have the balls to explore it. Many monks go there for their final test of religious training. There’s little to no technology, frozen rivers and almost no warmth. Many people do, in fact, die here. You’ve seen those ice bars and those buildings made of ice? That’s Pyatintsy. People do permanently live here, but very little of them do. They typically eat raw meats and fend for themselves. Tribal infighting is rare here, despite the four tribes which do live there. Astanrog Fortress of God Far away from Pyatintsy, a mountainous region with tunnels inside of it. This, however, is the headquarters of all monks and religious folk. Shaskala Corpo Palace Bylesk Home of the monks. this is where Khan had originally lived, a large mausoleum/monestary for monks and other religious figures. The whole monestary is dug deep into the mountains, a large connection of various tunnels. The whole interior of the mountain is inhabitable, almost like its own city. One of the wonrders of the world, since most of it is built with wood and little technology. Currently fighting with Pyatintsy politically. While people often go to Bylesk as their secondary vacation spot, most of the inhabitants are very secretive and absolutely hate tourists. However 75% of their funding comes from that so they’re just passively racist instead of actively against them.
docs.title: Sosolensk

docs.text: Currently run by Shenx , Stands for “The Last Hope” The Slaughterhouse Shenx’s bar. “*Like most days in the Slaughterhouse, it’s hot, sticky, and sweaty.* *Shenx hadn’t picked the most ideal environment for a bar. It’s almost always raining, despite the hideous heat, bringing with it an awful humidity which clung to Constantine’s clothes and made his shirt stick to his skin like glue. It reeked of the manure and rotting bodies of mice and insects from the nearby sewers, with mud and other bones pooled up near the entrance.* *it was placed at the end of a long, swooping hill, which meant any and all rain practically flooded Shenx’s poor room. Perhaps that’s why the rent was so low, but Shenx (despite everyone’s protests) didn’t mind, and neither did the old men who went there. Probably because they were so old and rotted anyway, so they couldn’t even smell— let alone taste the state of Shenx’s drinks and Shou’s food to begin with. They just liked the drama.* *And so here lies Constantine, as the rain titters outside on the flimsy, steel roof, fat drops of blood-tinted rain seeping down into a rusty bucket near the floor.* *Constantine nudges the outlet of his computer. He was kind of surprised that electricity still ran in this glorified tent.* *“Mmmm,” Shenx says, slipping up behind him. His wheelchair hums, brushing cold air against his legs. Shenx floats up, peering into the laptops screen. “Hacking?”* *“No,” Constantine said flatly. “Software updates.”* *“Uh huh, sure.”* Right now TLH operates out of his bar, The Slaughterhouse. Sho works there as a chef. Shes unironically good at her job, she just hates talking to people. When you talk to her in game, it takes of -1 HP TLH has actually made some progress dismantling Pyrrhon's power (particularly in their area and in the underground). It's all under the table deals, so people are currently under the assumption that TLH had ended a very long time ago and never exists. Goal Um. Well, they are essentially an intel brokerage company. They sell data and information, and use it to extort/blackmail people. Their primary way of doing this is through cybercrime, but they have other methods too. Constantine in particular is the leader of their cybercrime department, working with other people like Sho to develop, refine and deploy ransomware. They do RAAS but their rates can be quite high. However, cybercrime isn’t their only method of getting information. For one, they have Gamma and a few others. Sometimes, they will physically go to the servers OR just torture the people straight up until they get what they want. This delves into the ‘hit man’ portion of TLH, which is their other sector. Goldfish The brains Lead by Constantine , this is the cybercrime network. Goldfish is the name of the cyber crime section that Constantine runs. He mainly works in ransomware and double exploitation. TLH can be classified as a hacktivist group, but that isn't really what they do. Constantine does run the goldfish operation but he does have a team. Unlike freelancers, he and a few other members live in tlh for stable employment and forcefulnesss to remain employed. Gamma helps sometimes with immersion missions in which she deploys the payload directly into the server itself, and Constantine mostly does the remote work. They sell out their botnet and are popular amongst nerds for their ransomware which you can pay for. The thing with their ransomware is that they store a copy of your data no matter what. If you pay and yoy get it back, they still have your data and will use it as an additional source of income by selling it to competitors. If you don't pay, they'll release it to the main internet for everyone to see. Sho employs the man in the middle scams, the phishing the ftp and the bank fraud (like zeus). Constantine always targets the groups with very little technical knowledge and old companies first, then chisels (like the hit program) away at the newer ones. Constantine was caught once, because he used the same VPN multiple times and the government caught up to him. However Constantine is actually an undocumented citizen like anywhere, so he was able to get away and someone else died in his place. Goldfish, or at least Constantine , refuses to target healthcare unless he's paid generously for exploiting them Goldfish fluctuates in member count, but the general number is 60-100. A few core (haha) members do live physically with Shenx as additional protection and pressure. Lockpick The brawn. Lead primarily by Clementine and A few others, this is like the “fixer” division. The hitman dirty work. this is also where Gamma gets most of her work, but not all of it. Lockpick is mostly by request, either by Goldfish or if they’re commissioned to do a job. It’s really straightforward, I don’t have much else to say about it. They always send photo proof of the job being done. If the mercenary is killed and fails the job, another is sent until it works. For each mercenary sent, there is a +10% up charge. this Isn’t really common though.
docs.title: TLH

docs.text: Draft The opener is no cutscene, but instead Nea running through the forest from the nearby fire from the temple. You can fight a few things, and it teaches you how. Upon completion, she stares at the temple. It’s great, next scene is her working a 9-5 office job. She gets FIRED!!! Like a cut from the fucking burning fire looking at the temple, and then her hacking away at a computer “… This is boring. I should get coffee later.” You walk out of the office to go to the cafe and all her stuff is just fucking thrown at her while she gets a coffee. “Congrats! You’re fired.” “…….” “…….” “…….” “……” “…. Thanks.” “No this is serious we did a background check and we found that you—“ (Nea runs out) “—… were involved in a .. major historical fire, and…” “… she’s gone! After her!” This is the tutorial sequence that you can die from, in an office building. Nea eventually jumps out of the window and lands on a car. It swerves and throws her into a nearby alleyway. Nea gets up and wipes the mud off of her. Here, she meets a pi-bot who was alerted. This is because she literally landed on its car. You also crushed her head in, so.. just take her CORE. You are given a perma core and instructed to go out to the forest. at this time, you can explore more of the caves. This is the first area, congrats! The city is closed off because there are guards looking for a ‘runaway worker’. Wonder who that is! It is also the afternoon, and things will be different in the nighttime. They tell you to defeat enemies (plants) to be able to survive the night. It’s nighttime. A lever opens for a room near the entrance. When you enter, You see a blue Stickfig who appeared behind you. This is Gamma! She tosses her cig on the ground and activates her weapons. Insert dialogue here. Secondary boss, that you’re healed from! So this is where you’re introduced to physical damage and magic damage. While Nea is much weaker to physical damage, Gamma is weak to magic damage. If only you could get a special move in… Gamma’s pride is hurt when you ‘defeat her’, so she just leaves. There is a waterfall in the next room over. You can rest there. There is also a fridge where you can save LMFAO dont ask me why its there. The city is still being guarded so you have no choice but to find the NPC which gives you a small map, and defeat more enemies because its absurdly expensive. (Joke) You also don’t have to, you can also just go to the end of the map, where you spot Prodigal from a distance. You follow him. From there, you see Gamma. She’s laying on the ground with a power bank in her hands. You can pick it up, and also pick her up too. When you take it, something rumbles in the distance. a bomb is thrown— PRODIGAL!! Gamma shoots up. She suddenly collapses onto Nea. You ‘put her into your inventory’ LMFAOOGAHEHA You run with Gamma out the forest (it’s just your normal sprite) and into the next area, where you flick a lever to stop her. shift to a small campfire that Gamma made. They talk for a bit. “Oh.. so you’re from the temples? I guess that explains things.. You know, like why you have an abundance of magic and no idea how to use it. Haha, sorry! Sorry!” Gamma joins your party . Also, the city is open again. You can go there when youre done exploring. Upon entering the city… CTSCNE She spots a guy on the street. Prequel Story + LORE (my first draft,, i lost the other one) XD It’s a dingy night. A small boy named Marian, covered with scrapes and dirt, stumbles into a nearby town, gripping a scarf and a muddy medallion. Marian slides the medallion to an old woman, who gives him 3 months of shelter and a small wad of cash. A little less than expected, but good enough to last him a while. He stuffs it into his pockets and waddles over to a scruffy, orange-tinted man, holding a rusty tray of dry cupcakes. He sloshes over to him, kicking muddy water off of his dirty knees, and is handed a cupcake. The cupcakes, Marian would come to find, were salty, and not particularly good. But that didn’t matter, none of it did. Marian holds a pen, trembling, grime and oil smearing on clean, crisp papers. He signs his name and soul and life away for admittedly too-salty cupcakes. Earth, in 2XXX. 2012, God fell from the heavens. Angels crashed and burned, and all left behind in the slaughter was a small, gleaning green gem. That’s the PRODIGAL CORE, rumored to be the Core of life itself, the heart of God Himself. From the “rapture”, as it was called, 75% of Earth was wiped out. 75% of Earth is “No Man’s Land”, and 25% is all under control of Pyrrhon . Pyrrhon’s the maniacal maniac who harnessed the full power of the PRODIGAL CORE and brought Earth from the depths of hell: for a cost. All you need to know is now, Pyrrhon is in complete and total control of earth and its inhabitants. She runs “OZ”, the world IS OZ. There may be a government, but OZ holds so much power that they are completely powerless. Should OZ be brought down, so would the entire economy of the planet. Pyrrhon is a scientist, as mentioned. She and her friend, Reever, specifically had an interest in human experimentation. One of my many interests is human cloning! You might be able to see where this is going. All clones and nuclear experiments are done on small asteroid planets. One particularly noted is called FUTURE, where a lot of clones are produced. you might see the name “Gamma” mentioned— she is a clone from here! In OZ, there’s sub-categories. One of these sub categories is the NATIONAL GUARDIAN team. A national guardian is basically the only good job you can get without nepotism. On the outside, you fight. Defend the country. Become police, etc. that’s it. Then you join the National guardian team. —— It’s a dingy night. A small boy named Marian, covered with scrapes and dirt, stumbles into a nearby town, gripping a scarf and a muddy medallion. Marian slides the medallion to an old woman, who gives him 3 months of shelter and a small wad of cash. A little less than expected, but good enough to last him a while. He stuffs it into his pockets and waddles over to a scruffy, orange-tinted man, holding a rusty tray of dry cupcakes. He sloshes over to him, kicking muddy water off of his dirty knees, and is handed a cupcake. The cupcakes, Marian would come to find, were salty, and not particularly good. But that didn’t matter, none of it did. Marian holds a pen, trembling, grime and oil smearing on clean, crisp papers. He signs his name and soul and life away for admittedly too-salty cupcakes. Marian signs away to the National Guardian— a boy raised in a religious temple, who ran away to escape those higher than him. He is placed in a group with a grumpy old man as his leader, and another boy, named Khan. Khan has joined hte national guardian team to garner funds for his sister, who has unfortunately died before this point but now he can’t really leave. It’s here that they’re given a CORE A CORE is something that a national guardian has. There’s a rumor that Pyrrhon was the one who killed God and made the cores out of some of what she cut off of him. A CORE can be re used once a national guardian dies and placed into another, but what is it? A CORE with a peaceful owner does absolutely nothing. They will not advance, only live a normal life with above-average healing. With a CORE, you have a constant need for adrenaline, for hunger and power and action. Your CORE will level up from action and fighting, albeit extremely slowly. Even a NATIONAL GUARDIAN’s whole lifetime can’t get you to a good base level. Your CORE must be leveled up in order to be useful. You level up your CORE using other’s CORES. CORES are found inside of every single genetically modified being. Including cyborgs, Prodigal Cores, Robots, Clones, etc. When that being is killed, it’s absolutely mandatory you take out the CORE at the moment of death, otherwise the CORE will become useless, and the power will seep back into the Earth. You or the victim can take out the CORE. The CORE’s energy is plugged into yours via included adapter, then it disintegrates, thus fully killing and ending the soul of that who used it. The CORE takes away your soul. Whether it be involuntarily inserted, your CORE is your soul. WIthout a CORE, you cease to exist. Now, in order to clone, you need eggs to produce them in. A girl named Chou is a donor, and has been for the past year or so. She’s developed a platonic relationship with Khan, so he lives on for her. Anyway Anyway I forgot most of what happens in the prequel story, but blah blah blah immortality blah blah blah, Khan and Marian are homoerotic enemies blah blah blah Chou joins their team,here’s where things get really bad. Pyrrhon has a strange fascination with Marian. Whether it be his hard head and big muscles or his strange moral compass, she loves him. And she can do whatever she wants with him. “It doesn't have to be human,” says Pyrrhon, “It just has to be you .” …. On November 12, 2XXX, a child is born. That child is named Nea, whom Marian really really hates. He goes on his last mission with Khan and Chou, putting down a rebellion against Oz by a small group called The Last Hope, and Marian is so DONE. He gazes into Nea’s eyes, He realizes that he really does love Nea. Marian refuses to fight from this point on. He gives his magically-infused scarf to Khan, a soft kiss, and then runs into the night. Khan can only stare in awe. Marian is later found, frost-bitten and bleeding in front of a temple in the middle of the Forrest, clutching a small baby girl. He’s taken in, only because of Nea, and he rebuilds his life as a religious leader (apart from the one he was in previously). He remains a pacifist, and Nea grows as a relatively stable, but a little strange child. At age 18, a woman in violet and black robes waltzes into the lobby. Recognized as Pyrrhon, world leader. War leader. The only person in power and the only person to remain in power. Nea could really care less. Until she walks into her room and sees her father’s corpse, mangled and burnt. And who else to stand above it but that woman? “My daughter,” she says to Nea. “I found you.” ”I am not your daughter.” Her father coughs up blood. Marian, renowned warrior, accomplished magician. Cowering at her feet like an animal. Marian reaches into the depths of his chest, and out comes a beating heart. Not a heart, a CORE. A machine of dreams and delusions. Nea looks up at Pyrrhon. Nea equips the heart of her father, soaked with blood and gore and fat and wires. Pyrrhon looks down at her daughter. Nea’s a skilled swordsman. Launching forward in a flurry of attacks, but not enough! Pyrrhon’s quick on her feet, Pyrrhon’s smart. Why else is she a world leader? Her father lays motionless. Pyrrhon only grins. All Nea remembers from that day is running out of the temple, now in flames. Centuries of history and dreams of the unknown, all dancing in the wind with the flames.
